Between 2015 and 2020, The State of Acute Malnutrition was supported by theNo Wasted LivesCoalition, an interagency effort between Action Against Hunger, the Children’s Investment Fund Foundation, the European Commission Directorate-General for Humanitarian Aid and Civil Protection (ECHO), the innocent foundation, the International Rescue Committee (IRC), UNICEF, and World Food Programme (WFP). The CMAM 2.0: Reinventing Community Management of Acute Malnutrition grant supported by the Children’s Investment Fund Foundation that financed the No Wasted Lives initiative, is now closed.

div_hierarchy.text: DataResourcesNews & EventsResearch LandscapeCOVID-19 AdaptationsCoPsAbout usWebsite guideSubmit Data / Resources

The State of Acute Malnutrition website provides an overview of all available information related to severe and moderate acute malnutrition in both English and French. In bringing this information together for the first time, we aim to:Provide a single platform for coordinated data sharing for acute malnutrition;Improve the data quality of programmes;Identify gaps in data.Support improved use of data and evidence for programmes and policies for acute malnutrition.

Between 2015 and 2020, The State of Acute Malnutrition was supported by theNo Wasted LivesCoalition, an interagency effort between Action Against Hunger, the Children’s Investment Fund Foundation, the European Commission Directorate-General for Humanitarian Aid and Civil Protection (ECHO), the innocent foundation, the International Rescue Committee (IRC), UNICEF, and World Food Programme (WFP). The CMAM 2.0: Reinventing Community Management of Acute Malnutrition grant supported by the Children’s Investment Fund Foundation that financed the No Wasted Lives initiative, is now closed.
